intro: Melandrium sylvestre var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually glabrous, giving it its varietal name. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds.
